title.value: Stochastic Frank-Wolfe: Unified Analysis and Zoo of Special Cases
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at both the beginning and end of the provided paper text.
title.quote: Stochastic Frank-Wolfe: Unified Analysis and Zoo of Special Cases

extractions.description: The paper presents a unified convergence analysis of the Stochastic Frank-Wolfe method. It covers various practical cases and provides general convergence results for convex and non-convex problems without assuming unbiasedness of the gradient estimation, allowing for the development of new algorithms.

type.justification: The paper focuses on a unified theoretical framework for analyzing the Stochastic Frank-Wolfe method's convergence and does not primarily carry out experiments or empirical validations.
type.quote: Our analysis is based on a key parametric assumption on the variance of the stochastic gradients.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on solving constrained optimization problems using the Frank-Wolfe method.
name.quote: The Conditional Gradient (or Frank-Wolfe) method is one of the most well-known methods for solving constrained optimization problems.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses stochastic versions of the Conditional Gradient method.
name.quote: Following the trend, we consider a stochastic version of the Conditional Gradient method.

name.justification: The paper applies optimization techniques primarily to machine learning tasks.
name.quote: We conduct analysis for convex and non-convex problems due to the popularity of both cases in machine learning.

name.justification: Stochastic Frank-Wolfe is central to the paper's contributions, focusing on its unified analysis and application.
name.quote: We propose a general assumption on the stochastic estimator g^k from Stochastic Frank-Wolfe (2) – see Assumption 2.1.

is_contributed.justification: The paper provides a unified analysis and introduces new forms of the Stochastic Frank-Wolfe method considering various modifications.
is_contributed.quote: With this general theoretical framework, we not only cover rates of many known methods, but also develop numerous new methods.

is_executed.justification: The paper conducts numerical experiments to demonstrate the properties of the new methods.
is_executed.quote: We also demonstrate the properties of the new methods through numerical experiments.

is_compared.justification: While the specific experiments are not detailed in the text provided, the focus is on theoretical analysis and framework development rather than comparison with other methods.
is_compared.quote: Our general theoretical framework allows us to analyze different variants of the classical Frank-Wolfe method.

referenced_paper_title.value: Stochastic Frank-Wolfe: Unified Analysis and Zoo of Special Cases
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Stochastic Frank-Wolfe method and its variations are the primary focus of this paper itself.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose a general assumption on the stochastic estimator g^k from Stochastic Frank-Wolfe (2) – see Assumption 2.1.

name.justification: The paper uses LibSVM datasets for experimental validation of their methods.
name.quote: The comparison is made on LibSVM datasets w1a, rcv1.

referenced_paper_title.value: Libsvm: A library for support vector machines
referenced_paper_title.justification: LibSVM datasets are derived from this referenced library.

name.justification: LibSVM is utilized as a dataset source for the experiments in the paper.
name.quote: We take LibSVM datasets (Chang and Lin, 2011).

referenced_paper_title.value: Libsvm: A library for support vector machines
referenced_paper_title.justification: The infrastructure for providing datasets comes from this library, as cited in the references.
